Absolutely loved our stay.  Jake and Georgie are a delight. Cannot recommend highly enough and can't wait to return.  We've stayed at a lot of different accommodation at Falls over decades and Elk tops the list.  Dedicated pick up and drop off was icing on the cake and Jake was so lovely helping my elderly mother getting in and out of the vehicle!

From the moment we telephoned for collection and were collected in the wonderful over-ski mobile by Jake, our stay at Elk was just superb. It's a  wonderfully warm venue with modern and comfortable apartments, perfect location, excellent ski room, bar, restaurant, coffee and wine. We will definitely be back. Thank you Elk.

We loved Elk, the staff were very accommodating, Jake was awesome, communication was spot on. The transfer in the tracked 4 door Can-Am made it very easy to check in and out. Being able to ski from the front door to the ski lift and then from the top back down to the front door was great. Drying room for gear was fantastic. |The atmosphere and service in the cocktail bar made it a great place to relax at the end of the day. We'll be back.

Very nice, clean and simple room. Super nice to have the restaurant just upstairs for an easy meal. Awesome to get pickup and drop-off service to ATS, Jake was super nice and easy to co-ordinate a time for both trips. Would stay again.

My son and I had a wonderful stay at the Elk. Comfy and modern rooms with a well designed ski room and in room drying cupboard. The Elk offered us private oversnow transfer and a fantastic bar in Apartment 3. Jake and the team looked after us extremely well. I would thoroughly recommend the Elk at Falls for couples and family planning a trip to the snow.

We recently stayed at Elk at Falls Creek as a family of four and honestly, it was one of the best ski trips we've had. I actually sat on this review for a while because I kind of wanted to gate keep this place... but they deserve the shoutout.||The location is unbeatable! Elk is conveniently ski-in/ski-out, super close to the Cloud 9 lift (the main lift at Falls Creek and the meeting point for all ski schools and lessons). It's also a stone's throw from ski hire, the most popular restaurants, and the on-slope grocery store. When booking, I had considered other accommodation higher up the mountain and I'm so glad I didn't go that route.||We stayed in Apartment 4, one of the smaller two-bed configurations, it was incredibly well designed, well-equipped, and spotless. Our apartment had a fully equipped kitchen and drying cupboard, which was an absolute lifesaver for soggy ski gear. There's also a communal drying room downstairs  which is fitted out thoughtfully with plenty of storage for boots, boards and skis, a washing machine and plenty of benches to gear up before you walk directly outside onto the snow.||The Elk over snow transfers were a dream at the end of our commute from Melbourne airport. No waiting for Falls Creek paid service or dragging bags through snow or up stairs. Jake, who looked after our transfers and us during our stay was amazing. Friendly, on it, and always happy to help (even helped me to carry skis in each day when the kids had tapped out).||We ate at Sorella most days and managed to extensively test the menu. A must visit, conveniently located inside Elk, the food, wine list and coffee was amazing, the staff beyond friendly and attentive, and the best part? The kids could head back to the room while we finished our wine in peace. ||We were in the apartment directly under Apartment 3, Elks cocktail bar/lounge. We were a little nervous about noise but had no issues at all, No noise transfer. A few reviews raised issue with the noise from the pub down the hill. Whilst we could hear some background buzz it was nothing that interfered with us sleeping when we sank into the comfy beds after a busy day soaking up everything Falls Creek had to offer. ||Add in the magnesium hot tubs to soak tired legs, thoughtful touches , friendly service and the best snow access you could ask for it's no wonder we are already planning next year's trip.||Highly recommend for families, couples, or anyone who wants a comfy, convenient, and well-run base right on the snow.

The owner Jack and the staffs at bar and restaurant are super friendly. The room are super clean and very cozy. Highly recommend this accommodation if you travel to Fallscreek.|Definitely will return for next season.

We stayed 3 days over the weekend at ELK and it exceeded our expectations. The room was super clean, bed was very comfortable and the amenities were fantastic. Cant fault the place and the team were exceptional and looked after us really well.

We recently stayed at Hotel Elk in Falls Creek for a two-night family ski trip, and it proved to be the ideal base for our winter holiday. Traveling with our five-year-old child, we prioritized comfort, convenience, and family-friendly amenities--criteria that Hotel Elk met with excellence. We are lucky to be the first family visiting Elk this winter season.||From the moment we arrived, the hotel manager, Jake, served as our primary point of contact. He was exceptionally welcoming, attentive, and considerate. He treated all guests, including our young child, with the utmost respect. Understanding that children are naturally curious, he kindly allowed our son to sit beside him at the front of the oversnow vehicle, providing him with a wonderful view of the surrounding scenery.||Jake also provided a thorough orientation regarding the hotel's facilities and the transportation process. His generosity extended further when he offered us a complimentary late check-out on our day of departure. This gesture was tremendously helpful, as we had ski lessons scheduled that morning. The late check-out allowed us to maintain our normal routine, enjoy breakfast, attend lessons, and fully utilize our day on the slopes without the added stress of an early departure. It also allowed us time to rest and prepare for the long 5.5-hour drive home. Such flexibility is not commonly extended by most accommodations, and we deeply appreciated it. Jake's exceptional hospitality and outstanding customer service truly enhanced our stay--even our five-year-old continues to speak fondly of him.||The location of Hotel Elk is second to none. With genuine ski-in/ski-out access, we were able to access the slopes directly from the hotel, greatly simplifying logistics with a young child. It is also within walking (or skiing) distance of ski lifts, equipment rental shops, and several dining options, which proved highly convenient.||The beddings are clean, the pillows are fluffy and comfortable.||Our apartment was warm, modern, and immaculately clean, providing ample space for our family to relax after a full day of skiing.||We dined at the in-house restaurant, Sorella, on the evening of our arrival and found it to be both cozy and inviting. The staff were attentive and accommodating, particularly towards children. The menu offered a well-curated selection suitable for both adults and younger guests.||Additional facilities such as the drying room and ski storage were particularly useful for keeping our gear well-maintained. The area also included laundry amenities (a washing machine and dryer), which were user-friendly and invaluable for washing damp clothing and accessories.||The hotel's three mineral spas were a delightful feature--clean, powerful, and well-maintained. We are especially grateful to the staff who took the time to clear away accumulated snow and ice, ensuring the spas were ready for use on our first night. The water temperature was ideal, offering much-needed relaxation after a long journey.||If any improvements could be suggested, we noted that the dryer in the drying room required cleaning, as the lint filter had accumulated a significant amount of residue. We addressed this ourselves before use. Additionally, the bathroom could benefit from more storage space for toiletries--perhaps an added side trolley would be useful.||In conclusion, Hotel Elk was an outstanding choice for our family ski holiday. It delivered a perfect blend of comfort, practicality, and thoughtful service. We would not hesitate to return and highly recommend it to other families seeking a premium snow holiday experience.

Amazing place for family to stay, we arrived late at night, Jake picked up us and helped with all the stuff we brought in, nice room and friendly staffs . My kids loved the hot tub, I loved the dry room which I can get warm boots in the morning, you can ski in/out , will recommend to my friends.
Amazing rooms, was warm and cozy as I arrived. Very friendly staff.

Great room and facility, clean modern and fits well into the mountain surrounding.|Staff Georgie was amazing, helped us with lots of information, including walks and restaurants |Had a fantastic weekend |Would highly recommended staying at Elk at Falls
Great location. We weren't able to try the warm magnesium tubs. I would like to come back and try next time.

Well done ELK on making our stay last weekend so great. We travel a lot and its fair to say that Jake and his team communicate better than any place I've stayed.
The bar and restaurant are lovely with great food and the best coffee on the mountain. The room was neat and tidy and completely suitable for a few days at the snow. The drying rooms are a nice touch and a five minute walk to the Halley's Comet lift made for a great weekend.

We will definitely return to the Elk again for our next Falls Creek Holiday

Upon arrival we have been having trouble with the hotel manager Jake. Waited for a very long time at the accomodation transfer centre Falls Creek when we have notified well in advance for our arrival, just for him to show up rudely saying that he's ready to pick us up when we are and not taking care of our gears when we load it up all together to the buggy transport. Our snowboard and ski bag fell of the cart/tray of the buggy and we had to chase after it for him to notice it. Helmet was banged up, board and bindings were damaged. We have our beloved gear that are well taken care of and not a seasoned skiers or boarders with rentals (hence the DB journey bag, if you know you know)
Upon checking in, room wasn't ready, there were cleaners rushing here and there and we have been given the worst room to stay right across the staircase from above (room being in the basement floor). Moldy, small in space for even a family of 3-4. Booking was made months well in advance, paid more than normal rates and surely we'll expect better than this. It's a very discouraging start for our long awaited holiday and definitely a rip off.

We had pre-booked the stay with Elk six months ago and got locked into $3600 for three nights. Based on its uphill location and flourishing photos/marketing materials, we thought that'd be justifiable. However Jake the hotel manager came across very indifferent and rude from the start of the journey. We kept him aware of our arrival at ATS, after waiting 30 mins more we called him again and asked where he was, he negligently said I can be on the way if you are ready.. the baggage's were misplaced in the cart, and first thing that fell out as we were driving uphill was our boards.. The rest of interactions with him were very poor and the apartment's placed in the basement, tiny and mouldy.. There are whole lots of other options up there with similar rates, Elk unfortunately is a poor example of how hotel should run. We would like to warn those looking to book to think again.

Pro's
Spa, location, private transfer,

Con's
.No breakfast included (only a tiny breakfast menu available for extra purchase) Basically you have to go out for breakfast.
.No communal/games/fire/lounge areas (you are secluded to your tiny room on bad weather days .
.No sound insulation between rooms, you can hear noise beside and above.
.Dirty sheets
.Rooms don't get serviced, not even over 7 days

Conclusion

You pay a lot for very little, lonely, soulless. I will commend Sorella for nice dinners ( however, extra $$$ of course!!!)
The Elk was a beautiful place to stay and we were treated wonderfully by Leanne who helped us with a last minute room. Such great, comfortable rooms and cosy vibes! Thanks so much

Nestled in Falls Creek, a gem so sweet,
A hotel where memories and good times meet.
Jake, the legend, checked us in with grace,
Ignition festival vibes, a smile on his face.

Perfectly placed, just a stroll from the Pub,
In the heart of the action, a prime little hub.
Spas with magnesium, a cyclist's delight,
Easing the body after a day taking flight.

Above and beyond, Jake's service so grand,
A weekend so epic, in this mountainous land.
We'll be back for sure, can't wait to roam,
See you soon, Jake, our Falls Creek home!

Excellent accommodation choice at Falls Creek. Jake and the team at Elk were friendly, welcoming and organised and made our stay a smooth and pleasurable one. The included transfer service took the hassle out of getting from the Transfer Terminal to the accommodation with our luggage. Definitely will be back when are next at Falls!

Such a beautiful accommodation I stayed here for 3 day with my family it's really close to everything. The bars and restaurants down stairs are so good and the cocktails are amazing and the staff are so friendly
The room is very cozy, and supplies three big hot spa tub for relaxing after you ski. Hotel is near the main chair lift. Jake is really nice and hospitality.
Elk is piece of European paradise just a hop, skip and jump from Melbourne.  Do yourself a favour and forget about Buller.  Elk is incredible.

We stayed in September which is off peak so the breakfast was limited to toasted sandwiches (bacon and egg, ham and cheese or vegetable). These were not good. It would be so easy just to serve bacon, eggs and toast instead but they refused.
The biggest problem however was the stupid phone app that you need to use to access the rooms. It is a hassle to set up and it is a total pain when you come in from the snow to get your phone out and take you glove or your goggles and beanie off just to activate the phone so you can get in. It also means you and the kids have to carry their phones everywhere or they can't get into their room. They apparently have wrist bands but didn't have any available. I won't stay here again purely because of this.
On the positive side Jake, the cocktail bar and the restaurant were superb.

I've been travelling to Falls Creek for many years now and have stayed in many of the available apartments and lodges. Having found Elk, i feel the search for our home away from home at Falls Creek is finally over. The Apartments at Elk are modern, clean and comfortable. Facilities are excellent. The staff are friendly but unobtrusive. The location is perfect. Bob Sugar, the restaurant located on the ground floor is great for breakfast, lunch or dinner followed by a trip to the cosy bar. To cap it all off, Owner Leanne has been great to show us around and introduce us to Elk and Manager Jake - well you could not get a better host. We stayed a couple of times during '22 season and can't wait to return in '23.
The experience was just amazing! Great location ski in ski out, and Jake is so kind!
Restaurant service was terrible, overpriced and was notified about added %15 surcharge at the end of the service when it was apparently "everywhere", would not come back

I highly recommend the beautiful apartments and all the facilities of Elk. Leanne and staff (particularly Jake) are so accommodating and nothing is a problem. Wonderful views, absolutely prime location, ski-in-ski-out, and a great breakfast, too!
Great location ski in ski out. Helpful service carrying bags on the snowmobile. Very good to have drying cupboards for all your wet snow gear to dry overnight.

Stayed in their suites.

Thought we found our fav hotel at Falls. So many things to love about the place but there are a few major flaws that make me think twice whether I want to stay here again.

Pros
- Jake is so well organised and does not drop the ball. A smooth pick up and drop off!
- No horrendous stairs to climb up at ski in time. Only down.
- Complimentary breakfast (although inconsistent)
- A section of the closet has a heater in it for your ski gear.
- Storage to keep your luggage after check out.
- Outdoor spa is amazing in the 

Cons
- Pillows are nothing pillows and covers were dirty. Comfort = 0, Support=0
- If you want to sleep before 11pm, good luck. Can hear the floor above creaking as people walking non stop. So loud!! Also the doof doof music every night. Not sure if it's from The Man next door or from above, either way it's not enjoyable when you want to rest.
- Breakfast inconsistently cooked each day.
- Complimentary breakfast not so complimentary. Weren't made clear how it works. We weren't charged for extra's on first day but second day we were told it'll cost us. Doesn't make sense to order a simple scrambled eggs with a few extras because you will be charged $5 per extra. Just order the Big Breakfast instead and leave the things you don't want on the plate.
Wonderful cocktail bar

Whole experience from start to finish was amazing. Leanne really helped us last year when we had to reschedule. I was super grateful that they managed the pandemic situation really well. They also emailed me with updates regularly and even gave a detailed list of what we need to organise at the slopes and what they offer, ext. The service we got from Jake was incredible, especially since he was by himself (Two staff away due to covid) This guy was flat chat the whole time we were there, but never ever skipped a beat, he touched base during our 4 days. His organisation was just incredible. We were really impressed. He also did all of this with incredible customer service, he was really genuine and nice. I very highly recommend staying here if you plan a trip to Falls Creek. The hotel room was super comfy, they had chrome cast, heated wardrobe for clothes and it was warm. They have the spa, a bar lounge and Bob Sugar Restaurant, everything you need in one spot. And only a short walk from the chair lift. Cannot thank everyone enough for making out stay super comfortable and enjoyable. Cant wait to come back.

I didn't have many photos from the hotel, but photos on their website are what to expect. here is a beautiful bird that was outside our window and a gorgeous photo they had in the hotel room.
Had a lovely dinner with fantastic food  , will be back as it's always been a welcoming dinning venue
Didn't stay here only had dinners and drinks,didn't let me down at all
The ski accommodation hotel has a great location, but also has extremely cramped rooms.
Prawn dumplings were 10/10!
One star for accommodation, one for location, one for Jake who looked after us, one for restaurant/bar in the same building, one star for being earthquake proof!

We had the chance to stay in both the twin room and the sub-penthouse during our stay. Both were great value with impressive amenity and a lush modern fitout. The views from the sub-penthouse were stunning!

Location was perfect, just a few hundred metres (downhill!!) and you're at the bottom of Hailey's Comet ready to jet off. It seemed that every restaurant we tried was only a couple minutes walk away also, which was super handy.

Inside there is the bar and restaurant, both of which are top class and delivered amazing food and drinks time after time. No need to leave once you've had a big day out.

Jake was great - accomodating and very helpful. Booking process was practical and simple.

The 40deg spa after big days on the mountain really topped it off. Now a must-do in the recovery routine.

Would recommend to all and hope to be returning for another stay ASAP.
Love love love elk

Excellent location, quality accomodation, and most importantly - EXCEPTIONAL customer service. The free transform from ATS is certainly a game changer. We have been skiing at Falls for years and Elk was the best stay we've ever had. Will definitely come back.

Rude staff during lockdown/quarrantine. Reluctant to provide alternate dates and threatened cancellation fee even when I proposed new dates. They think they're the only ones experiencing pain during this tough time, and they are taking it out on their customers who have been trying to support them since the very first lock down in 2020. I could have had a refund, but instead deferred to this year to help support the business. Will NEVER book here again. Good luck Elk! You're acting like wild dogs!!

Unfortunately, I didn't get the opportunity to stay at Elk this year due to Covid and border closures in QLD. However, I wanted to give a massive shout-out to the team and thank them for their support, quick responses, and realistic covid booking/cancellation policy.  It is such a difficult time for everyone in the tourism industry and we look forward to supporting and rebooking our trip for next year.  For now, we must play in our own state.  Hopefully see you next year Elk xx

It's definitely the best place to stay in Falls Creek. We arrived just before the government announced state wide lockdown, but Leanne was really friendly and helpful at pickup even there were quite a lot to take as a business in this hard time. The communication from Richelle from the time of booking to the end of the trip was really clear. Jake was being absolutely great at drop off in our last day. Even though the lifts were closed and the restaurant was closed during our stay, but the luxury and comfortable accommodation, the heavy snow fall for 3 days plus the wonderful foods from Bob Sugars are definitely made our trip even more memorable than a regular winter ski holiday!!! I would highly recommend Elk for anyone planning a trip to Falls Creek and we can't wait for our next stay with Elk!!!
Dark inside. Had to use phone flash light to see the menu, food is great

Absolutely the best place to stay at Falls! Perfect location, fantastic amenities including loads of storage, spa for aching muscles and newly renovated apartments. Leanne and the team are awesome and the restaurant and bar downstairs perfect with a cozy fire for apres ski. So close to everything that you can come and go as you please. Will be back!!
Great service from Leanne and the team, awesome restaurant (thanks Bob Sugar team!) and bar, really convenient location in the village. We're looking forward to coming back.

We recently had the pleasure and privilege of attending the Elk alpine retreat. With the stunning backdrop of Falls Creek, our group enjoyed expertly guided hiking adventures, E-bike tours, Pilates sessions and invigorating yoga classes. The days were interspersed with nourishing, healthy and hearty meals. The accommodation at Elk and the bar are both delightful and welcoming, and the extremely talented duo of Leanne and Jake are to be highly commended for their fabulous hospitality. I could not recommend Elk at Falls highly enough!

Just returned from an amazing Alpine Retreat with Elk at Falls.  It was the perfect balance of mindfulness with yoga and pilates, hiking and e-bike tours through the beautiful countryside and delicious cocktails and food.  Heaven!
One of my favourite locations in Falls Creek Victoria. Stunning
Gotta love the snow
Very concerned that forced cancelations due to COVID-19 travel bans are subject to a $300 cancellation fee plus transaction charges. Not good enough.
Poor sound insulation rude staff and extra charge fee
Very good food, patient with the five children we had in our group and a good selection of wines.
If looking for accommodation or a great place to eat or socialise with friends highly recommend. In the heart of the action ideal winter or summer.
Beer was expensive otherwise good
Every time I come to the Snow Mountain, I will come to this store, first-class service and food

We had the steak and it was tender and cooked perfectly. Great steak but could have more veggies. The lamb shank was generous and fell off the bone. The desserts were delicious. The chocolate dessert was a hit and I had the rhubarb freddo which was amazing
Racial discrimination, dirty rooms, and poor service attitude lowered the impression of the entire snow village.
Fantastic food in the restaurant and some great cocktails in the cocktail bar!
Fantastic place to stay, in a great place easy to get to chairlifts. Restaurant is awesome!!

A.M.A.Z.I.N.G food!
We were there for Father's Day, they were great with the kids, also had plenty of marshmallows for roasting over the roaring open fire.
We make sure we have a meal here every time we go to Falls Creek

Have stayed at Elk for a number of years now for a weekend during the ski season. Rooms are great and Unit 2 has just had a complete renovation and looks great. The pick up service in their own oversnow transport is a great benefit. Easy ski in ski out location. Breakfasts are good generous serves at good pricing. The only letdown is the restaurant at dinner which is overpriced and food average. Otherwise a great place to stay.

I am a falls creek regular for the snow season. This was the first time I tried the elk after seeing it many times and regularly having dinner there. Unfortunately the accomodation is poor. The room we had, apartment 10 seems good when you first arrive, the layout and features are fresh and modern. However functionality not so much. We had a large bed, mind you two singles pushed together with a sheet over it; plonked in the centre of the room, good luck trying to walk around the side of it. The room was dirty and not clean at all. The toilet had "residue" on it, the floor felt gritty and not clean. These things are disappointing when you are paying a premium to stay at a place like the elk how ever these can be omitted from your stay due to the fit out and Qulity. The topper for me to mark the elk 1 star was the noise... why ohh why would you put a room directly under the kitchen when the floor is timber.... 530am the banging begins with staff and guests stomping around for breakfast.... and then dinner... that concludes at 11pm

Will I stay at elk again. Never, will I eat at the elk again, most likely not knowing the torture I am putting the people staying at apartment 10 under.

Very overpriced, terrible service and food did not match menu. We booked for a table for three and were put on a table for two, we had to place our wine bottle, water bottle and glasses on the floor to make room for the plates. Very noisy venue and one dimensional dishes
Did not feel welcome and would not come back
Overrated.
Awesome breakfast and lovely vibe to Elk. Always a favorite
Best restaurant in falls. Great GF options
Absolutely beautiful place and people at ELK. We stayed over a long weekend and could not have picked a better place! Bazza knows his way around the kitchen too

Elk was great. We had lunch here twice during our 2-night snow trip and the food was consistently delicious. They had $22.50 daily specials which were great value for money, and the staff was very lovely. 10/10 would recommend and I will definitely be back the next time I'm at Falls Creek.
Wonderful accommodation. The heated floors are divine!! Highly recommended. Makes the holiday so much more relaxing and enjoyable.
Food was fantastic

Stayed at Elk over the weekend in the newly built penthouse apartment and my mates were on the level below.
Top notch spot. The manger was very friendly, approachable and helpful with any of our needs.
The views from the balcony were sublime especially whilst having breakfast from the table.
All the necessities were included and all appliances worked well.
The only down side is that the bed rooms are short of space for clothing and luggage. It's a bit of a tight squeeze around the bed units.
Would book again for a nice weekend away with a group of people.
Very nice, with great staff. Unfortunately rooms are beneath the restaurant, so constant noise from above
Excellent in every respect
Awesome, quick service by Rhiannon, amazing food & great ambience. Wld highly recommend. Great suggestion from the best ski instructor Peter Steiner at Falls creek.
The meals are amazing. The staff are great, friendly and efficient. Barry Iddles is an excellent  host.
Great place for lunch.

Food and service great.
Large portions.

The ambiance of the restaurant was lovely and the staff were very helpful. The food was nice, though not the best. However, we arrived at 7 and were asked to leave at 8:10 given someone else had booked our table. We felt this was a bit sudden, and weren't quite ready to leave. We'd have been alright with this if we'd been told at the start of the meal but an hour to order, eat and enjoy a meal seems quite short.
Great service, the food was incredible. Easily the best salmon I've ever had, and it's reasonably priced as well. I'll definitely go back when I can.
Get the breakfast toastie
$14 brekky and early bird dinner are great value
Fantastic food with generous portions. The beautiful interior design and fireplace was perfect when coming off the ski slopes.

Had dinner at the restaurant which was great and vegan friendly (apart from desserts). Staff were eager to help out with the ordering process and happy to recommend items on the menu.
Unfortunately less could be said of the reception staff (Leanne was her name) who made some very classist remarks on the phone today. We considered booking at Elk for accommodation and saw some package deals they had on for September. As a few friends were joining us, we obviously had to consider a budget. The receptionist made some curt remarks of how they're the "second most expensive lodge on the mountain" and if we wanted something cheaper we could "look everywhere else but here".
Thanks for that- we're well aware of the expenses of skiing and how its out of reach for a lot of people who can't afford to go. We have been lucky to stay at QT (which is more expensive) twice and have a Hero Pass- we are no strangers to the mountain and were considering a change for our friends whom we enjoy treating to trips to the snow as we are locals.
After that conversation with reception and their haughty, snide remarks about cost, I'm glad to be taking our business elsewhere.
Come for the food, but stay anywhere else :S

Have had a great dining experience at the restaurant though was treated in a rude and condescending way over the phone when booking accomodation. I'm a regular to Falls Creek and a local North East resident.

I'll recommend the restaurant for sure but custom set service for the apartments was not good.
Best meal in town especially value for money when eating early bird dinner. Let's  not forget best egg and bacon sandwich,  huge and vyummy

Absolutely terrible food
Don't go here
Not enough food on your plate and I asked for salsa and they had none and I asked for sour cream and they had none
So outrageous service
The food tastes terrible
Don't go here it is atrocious food and service
Very warm reception but the beds and pillows are way too soft. All the back pain sufferers, don't say I didn't warn you.
Great atmosphere in front of their gorgeous open fireplace. Incredible food at a great price with the friendliest staff you'll meet. One can't go wrong at Elk!
Best breakfast on the hill. Always professional service, pleasant atmosphere and great location. Hard to beat in Falls Creek.

Elk is easily the best dining experience on the mountain. The friendly staff and delicious food make for a great time. Free fire roasted marshmallows an an excellent addition and I could not recommend this establishment more. Say hi to Barry for me.
Brilliant customer service at the diner. Very professional and reasonable prices.
Very nice
Great food and fast service
Terrible food!
Beautiful food. Fabulous service
Great place with fantastic atmosphere
Don't tell anyone how good this place is...  Service, food and Peroni on tap are standard.
Just great place to eat and socialise
A really great place. Great job Barry, Shannon and Claire.

We had a fabulous time at Elk . There were 4 families we had two Apartments beside each other. The rooms were beautiful , warm lots of light and afternoon sun.  Ski in ski out a beautiful open fire to enjoy a red at and I had the best beef cheeks at Elk Restaurant we will be back.
Great food and great service
Great place, lovely staff. The apartments are new and we'll provisioned.
Yummy brekkie.p0
Very relaxed place to stay and can't really beat the facilities or the location for that matter. Will definitely use again.
Great place to stay and dine. Excellent facilities, truly ski in and ski out. Super Central and easy to find. Great restaurant with something for everyone. Won't break the bank.
Busy weekend could only book at 5pm for early bird dinner. Ordered drinks and food. Food came before drinks as well as wine for meal Need to improve to get me back.  Food good.
It was lovely. And great idea roasting Marshmallows on the fire.
Great place to refuel after a day skiing. And the breakfast is outstanding.
Friendly staff, great food and a place to tie your dog up in the lobby away from the snow or rain.
Very good !!!!!
Great service and atmosphere
Pretty good, food is decent but expensive
Lovely ambience with a beautiful open fire centrepiece. Service was good, food mostly good.
Nice new place
absolutely divine and amazing service especially for my school group
A boiled potatoes would have been better
A boiled potato would have been better
Top notch coffee, and I would recommend the smash avo.
Wonderful service however a little slow
Excellent service. Great atmosphere. The open fire brings a warmth much welcomed at the snow. Food is superb.
One of the best resto in falls creek! nice ambience..good food and friendly staff.
God for family on a budget
Really nice deserts and fast serving times! Make sure you make a reservation though!
Elk was faultless!  Loved everything.....my kinda' place!
Delicious

Stayed with a bunch of friends in one of the apartments. So clean, tidy and organised. Very comfortable beds, it has everything you need. Also the restaurant downstairs is awesome. Steak was incredibly good. Just make sure to make reservations because it's always very busy.
Delicious 12inch sub breaky
Great food and drinks, and a friendly atmosphere. Grab a marshmallow and toast it in their open fire while you're there!

Incredible to find such quality restaurant up in the snow. The food was amazing , great service by the friendly wait staff, nice cozy atmosphere, there really is nothing to fault. Will definitely be going back again next trip.

I cancelled my reservation with ST Falls Hotel over TWO months ago and have been chasing my refund ever since. I have sent two emails, made two phone calls, and even visited the hotel in person last week, where the manager assured me the refund would be processed immediately.

It's now 60 days later and I STILL haven't received my money. No confirmation. No follow-up. Nothing. This is completely unacceptable and shows a total lack of professionalism and integrity.

Under Australian Consumer Law, I'm entitled to a prompt refund. The fact that I have to keep chasing you for what is legally mine is beyond frustrating. Your failure to act is not only a terrible customer service experience, it's a breach of consumer protection laws.

If you value your money and your time, do NOT book here. I will be reporting this to the ACCC and relevant authorities.

Just had a really good stay after being upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment (yay!). Staff were very helpful and the location makes life so easy for ski school dropoff. The hot tub was great after a day of skiing too.

We had a fantastic stay at St. Falls Resort, and a big part of that was thanks to Jerry from customer service. He was incredibly helpful, attentive, and truly dedicated to making sure our experience was smooth and enjoyable.

From the moment we arrived, Jerry went above and beyond to assist us always with a warm attitude and genuine care. It's rare to come across such professional and thoughtful service these days.

The resort itself is beautiful, but it's the top-notch service that really sets it apart.
Highly recommended, and a special shoutout to Jerry for making our stay so memorable.

Terrible customer service. Staff are unhelpful and just push responsibility around. After cancelling my booking, I was only offered a vague credit with no clear rules. Absolutely no real support when you need it. Never coming back!
Don't waste your money. Was better options for places to stay! Not worth the $$ and staff were not helpful. Will not return!

St. Fall Resort were absolute beauties and best service in town.. represented by Rachael, Kaili and Flavia. Them 3 are hardly working and best customer's service.

Please review their performance and proud to promotes

Lovely clean modern accommodation,  fabulous staff and a great location.
Kate the manager was incredibly helpful when we had a crisis xoxo
We will definitely return again.
The 1550 coffee is good and the price is better than another place we visited for coffee this morning.
Beautiful place! I really enjoyed coming here. It was a very comfortable room and a great spot.

We had booked accommodation with St Falls Resort last year, but my husband became unwell and we could not go on the holiday.  There was no requirement for the resort to give us a credit but they have bent over backwards to book us accommodation this year.  The service and understanding we have received from Maclain and the team has blown us away. Thanks you so much, we are looking forward to our stay in July.
Nice place to visit

Family of four stayed in June 2024. We booked a one bedroom with sofa bed and spa, and luckily got upgraded to a two bedroom. Wed definitely needed the two bedrooms in hindsight! The location is fantastic and suitable with two young kids lugging their ski gear everywhere. The rooms were great, with a full kitchen set up. The staff were helpful and pleasant. It snowed nearly every day we were there (late June). It was a magical holiday.
We go here almost every year! Absolutely love this place!

Kate and the team do a magic job to keep the place at an awesome level.
Great location, easy access to lifts , very clean tidy places with spa.
Great coffee and cakes.
Look elsewhere, not worth the money

Excellent location! But unfortunately that's where it ends.
We had horrible service from check in, all the way through.
We found the staff pretty helpless regarding resort information. Our apartment spa was not working and was not addressed during our stay, our living area was also missing blinds.

Very very poor value for money. Would not recommend.

Also just just learnt the apartments are privately owned and are not all the same

Best place to stay in Falls Creek with easy car access, ski in/ski out option, beautifully decorated rooms (we stayed in W308) and an amazing team from the St.Falls resort that try to make everyone's stay an unforgettable experience. Can't wait to book my next stay at St. Falls.

Great location on slopes
Excellent snack shops nearby
Negatives: didn't clean the rooms, no orientation or guide to amenities, no linen or towel change, no replacement of tea coffee, stingy amenities
Good outdoor spa and daily servicing
Disinterested staff
Great rooms, good location would return.

Staff were very accomadating and kind.
The place was very clean and tidy and had everything we needed.

Highly recommend.This my 3rd time I have stayed and every time same experience.

One of the worst dining experiences I've
hot chocolate, no milk, sugar or tea spoon. I had asked twice, once each for milk, then sugar, ended up using my fork to stir my tea, as asking a third time is B.S. IMO.
Good bacon, good hash Brown, but very poor French toast, the worst I've had.
Great location and good looking Restaurant, pitty the meal and service was so poorly, bitterly disappointed.
Once you read the other reviews, you will see it's common place at this establishment, two stars is bloody generous IMO.
We love St Falls it's our favourite hotel at Falls Creek

Epic stay in the middle of all the action. Great apartments and the staff are all really helpful and friendly. The daily spa checks and treatments are great ensuring peace of mind as we soak our cares away!
Of all the resort accommodations I've ever stayed, St Falls is by far the best ever.  The location, the rooms and most importantly the hot tubs are all amazing.
Super nice staff, great food and in an awesome location.  Rooms are nice with great views of the valley or the hill. Would recommend
St Falls Resort is our favourite place to stay at Falls Creek.  The facilities, accommodation, service and location are fabulous!  The hassle free drive in ski out is awesome!
Enjoyed a quick cuppa and snackbefore moving on. Great vegan chocolate cake!
1550 Cafe excellent, great to see Will barrista/ing

Do not stay here.  Soundproofing is appalling.  We have been kept awake multiple nights due to our neighbors in the floor below having a wow of a time  in the spa (which sits directly under the bedroom windows of our apartment).  We can hear every word they say (even at normal speaking voice).  Apparently reception can't do much about it because it's an owner.  But as a guest paying significant sums of money you can't make noise after 10pm.  You also can't even speak to anyone at reception after 11pm to try and problem solve the issue.

3 star service apartment with 5 star price tag. Terrible sound proof, can hear our neighbours conversations all the time and the noise downstairs. Our one bedroom spa apartment view was facing the carpark which is very disappointing and I booked 9 months ago!
In terms of customer service, there was none. I asked them if they can please give me lift to spa up the road because I have an ACL knee injury from DAY 1 of my 7 days ski trip, I can see the hotel buggy just sitting at the front from my bedroom all day. They said its not for guests, only for the staff. I asked them I have been sitting in the apartment for the last 5 days just hoping to do something to make myself feel better but the response from them was cold , hard: 'no, sorry we cant help u.' This is not a 5 star hotel service for sure.
The rooms are comfortable, clean and tidy. The location is excellent and the service was great.

At restaurant 1550 We waited for more than 30 mins for the food to come and then found a beetle falling out from my salads. The staff said they could refund the food and then took my food away. On checkout the staff said my food has been discounted so we paid the bill. After we arrived home, we realized they only discounted $5 for only 20% food I have consumed. Have written complaint email to them about my experience but never responded! Even no apologies. Very unpleasant experience about the waiting time, their overcharge and attitudes in regards to complaints. Never visit again!

What a fantastic location. You couldn't go past this, right at the base of Halley's Comet which meant not having the wait forever for the village shuttle - which we did last year because we stayed further away and wasted so much time. It's next to falls creek sports and homebase to pick up all tickets and ski hire, and there's restaurents, cafes and a supermarket literally next door. The apartment was spotless. Had everything we needed including a fantastic drying cupboard and good heating. We used the pool and sauna which was lovely. The people working are also super nice and helpful and they allowed us to check in very early and also came without delay to help fix our tv. The restaurant 1550 was also very nice and the staff there so lovely. But without doubt it was the location that makes it worth every $$. Thanks again to everyone there. We will definitely be back next year without doubt!

Our issue was not with our stay but with the fact this accommodation and their staff lack a level of customer care. We had this accomm force a cancellation last minute as they tried to extort more money a couple of weeks before we were due to stay. We booked more than 3 months in advance for 6 people and were in constant contact right from the start and paid a substantially deposit. This place was a 2 bedroom apartment and we made it clear there were 4 adults plus 2 children.
They never mentioned any additional charges up front.
However, a couple of weeks out after the cancellation period had lapsed we had the accommodation contact us and tell us that we have to pay $75 for an extra "bed"
They continued to contact us and the story changed aswell as the price going up to $100 and then $150 for first the use of a futon couch and then a "per child" fee.
This place caused absolute undue stress and we had to find somewhere very last minute.
But the way they approached things lacked any customer service and seemed quite odd and off.
We actually reported these guys to consumer affairs and the ACCC.
Don't risk the stay here.

I'd like to start by saying we booked pretty late, and as a result paid probably a lot more than your average room. It was definitely on the expensive side, and for that price you would expect top quality in most if not all respects.
The apartment itself was fairly small. We had a 2 bedroom spa apartment, and it was just big enough for 4 people.
The room itself was wildly under equipped with basic cooking essentials. We mentioned this to the staff, and they did everything they could to find what we needed, big props. It turns out the rooms are privately owned, and so if the owners haven't equipped the rooms properly for cooking and cleaning, it's St Falls who end up looking bad. We really appreciate their assistance with everything trying to help out where possible.

Location, bang on. Literally doesn't get better.

Bedrooms and bathrooms were functional but not efficient. The exhaust fans in the bathrooms didn't do a whole lot, so foggy mirrors was a regular occurrence.

The sofa bed was also a bit rough to sleep on. We found that in order for it to be comfortable enough, using the doona under and over the top like a burrito worked the best for extra padding.

Heated floors throughout the apartment were fantastic. No issues at all.

A few things to note is that St Falls has only taken over from QT, so the resort is still needing a fair bit of work to get to what they are charging. Additionally the pool is not what we were expecting for a 5 star resort, more like a large kids pool.

All in all, we enjoyed our stay, and think that even with everything, the location made it worthwhile to stay here.

Gym and pool included. Quite a lot of local restaurants and 30 second walk to the nearest chairlift. Rooms were lovely and spacious and service is great! Local supermarket right underneath the hotel, so super convenient!

Location was a 10/10 directly behind the main chairlift up to Cloud 9. Super easy to hire your gear from Base Camp in the same complex as well as super convenient drive in location.
Staff were all VERY friendly (Michelle) and everyone really helpful.
Restaurant 1550 simple but really delicious food we ate there twice and great coffee, again friendly staff (Amber)

Perhaps the only drawback given the price of what you are paying is the quality of the rooms. Slightly run down in need of some new blinds and furnishings and no cleaning service.

Management is new and they are doing their very best first season in.

Have booked for two trips next season already.
Best location to the main area and lift up the mountain, good amenities (heated pool and steam room) ski hire etc, food and beverage, parking etc. wouldn't stay elsewhere

So disappointing.
The place is rundown. I understand that management has recently changed but it is unfair to charge 5 star prices for a 2 star establishment. Checkin was delayed by over an hour beyond the already very late checkin time of 4pm because the couch was broken. No chance of getting into the room for a quick afternoon ski. Two days later on a rainy day while watching a movie we were all displaced by the delivery guys literally tearing the broken couch apart to get it out of the room and bringing a new one in. The room is tired. Paint peeling. Cheap furniture. No complete sets of any glassware or crockery. For $1800 a night our spa looked over the public car park so no view and no privacy but a great deal of noise despite a view being advertised. The location of the hotel is so convenient, but think twice before booking if you are accustomed to high quality accommodation.

Worst Restaurant on the Mountain. Should be the last place you would want to visit to eat.

If you want to experience the worst customer service and a group of really rude staff then this is your place.
This place is amazing. Michelle and her team on the front desk are so friendly and helpful! This is what we love about Falls Creek and we will definitely keep coming back. Highly recommend!

My family and I decided to stay at Falls Creek during the Queens Birthday long weekend. I was really impressed by all the staff given their politness and willing to assist us on all our concerns. The rooms were small but modern and kept warm all day round. Thank you to the team.

Lovely accommodation. clean, neat and comfortable.

Restaurant has great food too.

This hotel has been recently taken over, and having myself owned a venue during Covid-19 I was generally willing to give them the benefit of the doubt, as Kate (A very hard working manager) tries to get the team up to speed. You have to consider that this Hotel cost us $540 per night. I've stayed in some pretty fancy hotels around the world for less than that, so I have some small expectations of a hotel in this price bracket. However my patience ran out quickly. In what should have been our last evening of sitting on our balcony enjoying the view. We could NOT sit outside as several members of STAFF were below our balcony SMOKING (for 3 hours) in a hotel? In 2021? Bizarre!! Further to this the STAFF conversation was mainly centred around which customers had been a pain during...
Great spa, stunning view dow the Kiewa Valley.
Really impressed with the skidoo tours. Such a wonderful way to see the resort. Bruce and co were really helpful in explaining the scenery.

Great place to learn how to ski with lots of tracks for all levels 

Best time to visit is during June-August as there is more snow that time. You can also rent lodges in front of the ski lift for convenience but keep in mind they are around $1200 per night. 

The staff are really nice and always strike up conversations with you on the mouse trap like "how's your day going?" or "Give me a fist bump man!" 

The weather is really cold and I ended up not wearing my goggles because it was really snowy and foggy in that day. 

I was a beginner and had just started skiing with no experience and I learnt quickly and went on to ski the blue and green tracks on my second day so I do recommend taking classes.  There are adult and child classes depending on your level.

Definitely recommend Falls Creek! Staff are nice and lifts and transport are nice and well kept too!  Will definitely come back next year!

Disrespectful Pricing, No Support -- We're Going Elsewhere

Spent over $2,400 for just 3 days of skiing with the kids -- and on top of that, they charge you just to get the card for the lift pass. Had a genuine medical reason (broken toe) and tried to request the early bird discount after missing the deadline, but no response for over 3 weeks. No phone number. Just emails into a black hole.

Customer service is non-existent, pricing is predatory, and there's zero compassion or flexibility. Everything is overpriced -- rentals, tickets, even kids' lessons. The system is built to extract every dollar while offering the bare minimum in return.

We'll be taking our family to a snowfield that values its visitors and treats them like human beings next time-- Falls Creek is not it.
Good skiing

Great place, it misses on a star for the price as a lift ticket for 1 day is around $170. Definitely get the cheap passes if you are staying longer but otherwise just as expected, great lifts and good runs would come back
snowy
It was amazing place especially in the winter. We have enjoyed a lot. Paradise for ski people.
nice place

Fallscreek on 07 June 2025
Awesome light snow fall
Expensive but good

the staff are so rude and have power trip when operating the lift
the girl at the bottom was doing 2 things at once and just sent me up without telling me about it and it was my first time on the ski lift so i was confused and scared. girl working  at the top was nice though. they also dont have any beginner bits on the mountain and for a one time visit why did it have to be $200 like be for real. anyway the blonde girl operating the bottom lift is rude and will be sarcastic towards you so have fun with that.

Inaccessible support, lessons & ski lift - support via email only, very ineffective and inflexible.

Agree with another reviewer, almost just a cut and paste reply.
For the price that we are purchasing things, it's just not good enough!
Sorry, but very disappointed..
Must visit spot wonderful experience
Great place to ski on holiday with friends or family, many black lane for experts, enjoyed it a lot!

Beware of pre-booking lift tickets or lessons, if you suffer an injury no refunds will be given. They will only give you a credit that only lasts one year, which forces you to return to them next year.
A wonderful time! Lake is so pretty

Underwhelming for the prices charged. Found it extremely expensive in general. Most, if not all of the staff and mountain users I spoke to agreed

Runs were nice, cracking scenery but super pricey
I've heard there's some pretty good skiing and boarding here
Amazing place in the mountains , for skiing and staying. Great for taking pictures.

We had two lessons over the space of a weekend and Jimmy was our instructor both times. This was my mums 3rd and "final" time attempting to learn to ski with previous lessons at bulla and this time thanks to Jimmy we mastered it! Jimmy is an absolute brilliant teacher! We are so thankful for him and his skill, the way he explains things in different ways if you don't get it! Highly recommend!
Awesome place to take the family.
Poor snow in August this year.

Absolutely fabulous ski resort with great skiing and many good ski runs.
Also an excellent array of restaurants,cafes and bars.  Love this resort.
We struck the best weather and the skiing was awesome.
I recently spent a week here with my husband and 2 teenage children. We had a ball! Great atmosphere, great places to stay and eat and staff were super friendly. Great resort for intermediate skiers.
One of the best ski field in Australia. The Snow is very good and it kicks start a very good season of 2023.

This is a beautiful Ski resort with a stunning lake for fishing. It is also beautiful for hiking in the summer and mountain biking. The shops and restaurants were closed when we went there to have a quick look at the resort and wanted to grab something to eat. So just check restaurant opening times. But definitely worth a visit.
Nice tracks for all levels. Better choice for learning snowboard

Hugh ski resort both entry and intermediate level friendly. Was too busy playing ski and realised that I didn't have a lot of pictures. A little bit longer drive from Melbourne but you can park so much easier than Mt Buller.
Nice
Probably the best all round resort in Australia. Most consistent snow and plenty of terrain to keep you occupied.
best ski place ever
a last section of night run was completely blackout (no light pole), other than that was pretty good.
Beautiful place great for skiing staff a little rude and abrupt would come back simply for the skiing. Better probably in July and August
Any day on the snow is great. Bluebird day's count extra, heli transport wins for sure. Awesome trip

Covid aside I've been to Falls Creek most years since 1996 to ski. If you can afford it and you know what to expect (see other reviews for skiing) then fine. The key item is afford. You can't look out the window, see sunshine and think, today I will buy a lift ticket, unless you want to shell out 200 dollars per adult. tickets can be had cheaper if you book say two weeks in advance, but if the weather is dire and you don't want to ski on the day, money is lost. Yes you can cancel but by my understanding you loose 20 percent and the rest goes to a voucher that has to be used up in that season. On top of that the accommodation prices have rocketed since prior to Covid, it was always expensive but this is now "out of reach" expensive. On mountain facilities are of course captive audience excessive prices like concerts and sports events. So after all these years of being a loyal Falls Creek skier , I am now going to save up and ski somewhere where I don't feel I am being gouged and where the terrain, snow, food, facilities and weather , are significantly superior, e.g Japan
Amazing. Learned to downhill ski here. Lifts are great, just try not to stack it when getting off!
A great place for all ski levels. Especially those just starting.
After 5yrs we finally made it back & had a fantastic week
Love boarding at Falls Creek
Less family friendly than it used to be, but still a fantastic destination.
Loved this place. Too bad l didnt take enough photos

Was my first time. Great resort awesome runs and all the staff that I came across were nice and helpful! Not even crowded and runs of all ski level. The slopes and terrains are breathtaking. Will definitely try to get back as soon as I can.

Don't bother going to the zoo, as they have a couple of baboons operating the tow rope (lift) at the bottom of Falls Creek. At approximately 11am on the 29th of July 22, a young girl and old man were rude towards me when I was trying to learn the tow rope for the first time.

WON'T BE COMING BACK HERE

Been going here for the last 25 years but I've noticed with Vail taking over the admin and the running of the mountain overall seems to have deteriorated. Not as much in summer but winter. Mountain staff not as attentive as they should, grooming of slopes not up to scratch. It seems a lot of the attention to the smaller details that are lacking.

Visited Hotham the previous year. Thought we try Falls Creek this year as beginner skiers. What an amazing experience. Great open sloped and staff has been super friendly throughout the stay. Me thinks we will definitely be back.
Great Park guys!
Much better than I expected an Australian ski resort to be. Plenty of space, great snow, on-mountain accommodation
Great snowboarding experience here! Excellent lessons and service!

Falls Creek is still a great atmosphere & good place to ski & snowboard with tones of variety to suit everyone. Special shout out to Steve who works for Falls Creek, was stationed at the base of the summit, who rescued my wife who couldn't get down. Excellent person and great service. He was gentle & kind.

Falls creek is great for families as it's ski in and out of your accommodation and easy to get around. The lessons are on the top of the mountain so dress warm. For experienced skiers there is plenty of terrain available when the snow is good. Particularly on the International poma side (yes old school).
Best ski resort in Vic
Customer service is appalling. Basically impossible to get a refund if you get Covid and can't go.

Good fun

.good lift lines
Great range of runs. Best for those with a bit of gumption who have skied or snowboarded at least once before...
Support is very much a copy and paste style, hopefully you won't need anything from them or else you will feel like reading the website because nobody will actually try to help.
Absolutely love Falls Creek and is my go to place to ride each winter! Ruined Castle, Summit and the Maze are some of the best parts of the resort.
Beautiful scenery, lots of bike trails/walking & hiking tracks of various difficulties in the off season.
Been waiting 8 months now for my refund, absolutely pathetic.
One of the best places in the world for skiing
Highly recommend for a family ski holiday.
Went during covid, still crazy costly and only 5 lifts working. Booking the first is troublesome, once you have an account it was easy

Love Falls creek, the park crew have a done great job this season.
Stoked to have been given the opportunity to ride in 2021!

Just amazing 
Feel like you stand on top the Earth
Shame covid  keeps  closing this magic resort
Love it there!!!!

It was beautiful sunny day.
They have better snow coverage than other snow resorts this year.
All staff at resort are wonderful and very efficient process.

Access from the carpark to chairlifts and restaurant were the most closest place out of all resorts in Australia.

We really had a great time.
Poor communication. No one is available to take your call to make queries or urgent changes to booking.
Broke my tailbone but had a great time otherwise
Visited in Autumn. Not many people. You can enjoy the beautiful walks. Magically. One downside is that not many food places are open.
Great place to visit... First time in Autumn Easter Break. Kids loved it
We had great weather, lots of blue bird days and the slopes were lit . Saw this one ski kid cause a 5 man pile-up and it made my day.
No snow falls yet but they selling entry for 59$ . Miss guided information regarding snow falls in their FB page.. complete waste of money and time.
Great family holiday, friendly mountain. Lots of great skiing
Great place to ski/snowboard.
Excellent place to learn to ski/board. Bring a group of 40+ high school students here every year.
Just love this place awesome hill.
Excellent as always
Fantastic snow and not many people
Best mountain in Victoria in my opinion. The resort layout is a bit all over the place but you can use that to your advantage and get away from the crowd.
Lovely mountain. Very open which is great for beginners and lots of challenging tree runs and features for advanced skiers. Highly recommend.
Fabulous skiing
Amazing place to go for the snow....easy to navigate around and very friendly staff and great views
Icy, insufficient coverage despite peak season, expensive lift tickets for this kinda conditions to ride in. Not going again.

Went to Falls for the first time this year for the snow season and will definitely be returning next year. The runs are longer and less crowded than Buller, and everyone from the staff at our accom to the gear rental place and the local eateries were super friendly. All in all, the atmosphere and the people were great and it is well worth the extra couple hours in the car.
Nice
Road to Hotham was closed
Great place, but they sent the tobogan area all the way to the end
Great experience!
Love coming to Falls for a week of skiing. Lots of different runs to explore. Something for everyone.
Very happy with this place, will return in a heartbeat.
We absolutely loved Falls Creek, and would return but only if the lifts were faster! Most of the day you end up in the lift waiting to get to the top...
Great place to come in winter with family
Beautiful
So good for family hang out and fun
Very impressed with Roger from guest services for making the drovers chair lift organised and made the wait less painful. Really appreciated his professionalism.

Would be 5, but road clearing, ice & snow, not good enough. Other International resorts especially Europe, very good snow ploughs & gritters running all night as necessary. I think this  is a Vic roads issue. To charge $67/day on top of rego is a scam & then not do the job properly. This needs sorting out, I suggest Auto machines like toll roads, say $10 each way then $5 on the Vic rego fee across Vic & the make montane roads safer with no need for chains as frequently. 'Shell be right mate' just ain't good enough

DODGY DODGY DODGY

HOTHAM ENCOURAGES YOU TO SKI WHILE ILL! THEY DO NOT OFFER ANY REFUNDS FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE UNWELL AND UNABLE TO SKI AND ENCOURAGE YOU TO VISIT WHILE ILL!

Hotham is a dodgy resort operated by the company Vail which is a company with no interest in people's wellbeing. Structured to avoid complaints I watched several people be rejected by Hotham to go deal with Epic and Hotham actively didn't help several paying customers with issues with there lessons while I watched and was also not helped...

I recently took a family trip to Hotham. My 11 month old daughter contracted gastro while visiting and we had to go to hospital on our first night. The local nurse and doctors told us that there was a fairly large and severe gastro outbreak causing people to present at hospital and many were coming from Hotham. No such warning from the resort though.

When I was unable to utilise my ski lifts and lessons they refused to provide me a refund and said I had to be sick for over 30 days for them to provide a refund.

I am not wealthy and am a disability support worker and when a company who makes that much money doesn't provide a refund for services they didn't provide I see red. I cannot afford another trip to Hotham and they made it absolutely clear that they would prefer me to ski and spread the sickness than to come to any fair conclusions. As a result I went skiing on the last day after they refused my refund and informed everyone I could that I was unwell and to keep a distance.

They don't care if there resorts make no money, if they ruin pristine natural environments and charge exorbitant fees for lift tickets and offer no refunds if you do not use them due to sickness. They charge $150 a day for those lift tickets and they run regardless. Dodgy as. Skiing cost me about $400 a day from lift tickets to gear hire and lessons and I just hoped to recouped $150 per day of that but they refuse. ACCC here I come.

I will leave a review like this on every Vail resort every week until they respond and I will keep smashing them with complaints and everything I can. Dodgy, dodgy dodgy....
Great place to play ski n boarding
Great snow, good vibes, excellent terrain park.

Great Mountain, pretty good snow, but resort management need a good hard look at themselves. Lifties werebarely interested in guests, no music or atmosphere, the snow on the lift queue area was never managed . Transitions were poorly placed (too high)
The opening of the lifts each morning is done in such a poor way that the runs get trashed because everyone is kept in the same area , Heavenly gets trashed then slow opening for Gotcha, it gets trashed before they open Keoghs, it gets smashed and then the open Orchard and the lines are huge, just dumb!!
Open the mountain at 8am and let everyone spread out.
Loved it! First time visit to the snow and was great for us as a family!!

Was with a group for beginner snowboard lessons and had Lachie as our instructor. He was amazing and really helped the group learn fast and effectively. By the time we were done everyone was riding the long tracks with ease!
Thanks Lachie!
The prices they are charging are simply criminal!
Management and Facilities all rubbish, you can't change permit on the vehicles even proof that is your own vehicle.

Great place to ski (or snowboard), lots of different difficulty levels, great village areas. Also have lessons too and hire place for the gears. Very crowded though so plan your visit accordingly. The best thing about the resort is they run the free bus from Wire Plain to Hotham Central so if you can't get a car park on Hotham Central (you'll need to be very early to get one), you can park further and grab the free bus to the central. Overall very happy with all the facilities.

Simply Beautiful during snow season. Plenty of snow activity.
For first timers, make sure you are aware of the shuttle services, which one drops you where, times, etc.

My children have completed lessons twice over this winter, and for something so costly, I was mortified at how unorganized (not to mention the lack of information on the website for new-to-the-mountain families) the staff and people on the mountain were.

To put into context, ONE single day of lessons for two kids (with the mandatory lift pass) was nearly $800. We were told the wrong location, then reprimanded because we were late, and then a staffer said "well it's pretty self explanatory"

The mountain needs to make this more affordable and more informative. The website is very dated. The kids ski school isn't outlined in a way that makes people understand where they need to go to check in, and what exactly each group is doing and when they eat etc.

Lastly, our second set of lessons said "enrol your kids in level 3 next time" -- and all levels are animal names, so when I had to guess what that level was, we showed up to have registered in the wrong group - ultimately having to beg to allow my son into the next group because the original one was full!

OH! And the Epic pass doesn't offer 20% off food at all the cafes at the hill.. it's only select ones LOL. Spending thousands and thousands over a few days and receiving this kind of service is highway robbery.
My absolute favourite mountain in Australia. Especially when keoghs and orchard are spinning. Does get quite busy in peak season especially during midyear school holidays.
very nice and good location, one thing to complain is the bed is super soft
Best experience everrrr!!
Awesome ski resort.
Perfect spot for skiing/snowboarding. Had a great time. Was easy to navigate around and plenty of information provided.
Great place to enjoy
Great place
i want registration  new members

The resort is beautiful but the customer service staff and the resort  didn't want to help customer much. We booked the ski class , Consider we were new to the venue and their advertisements said all level are welcome there but it was hard to continue to the top of the mountain after we had accident that being hit by other skiers. They didn't allowed us go the lift although we already paid $221 fees per person as because of the potential injuries . We accepted it's ok for the snow credit to comeback when we have recovered but they didn't want to do that. According to consumer law, the customer shouldn't be charged for the service that they are not allowed to do. It was wrong from their advertising information on the internet so be aware !! If you are new to the ski then better to go to mount Bulla or other areas have better customer service. This company is horrible!

Absolutely terrible experience, when we bought the lift pass around 1230, the website shows 13/14 lifts are opened, my girl was hoping to join the night ski on a Saturday so we bought afternoon pass, by the time we were up in the mountains around 2:30pm, most of the chair lifts are closed due to the storm, it was so windy and freezing you can't even snow play outside, lack of information from staff, we have no choices just to stick around cafes hoping that some lifts will be opened later, we left after asking staff from rentals that all chair lifts were cancelled for the night, I was told that if we go to the service office the next day we can get a compensation pass to ski, however we need to head back on the night with 5 hours drive, so I emailed on the next day and all I got was their T&C no refunds or compensation due to weather, I mean I could further by consulting the CAV, because it was obviously a false prediction of 13/14 lifts are open at the time of purchase and they are closed within 2 hours, the fact that we spent $280 without any ski for my girl is very disappointing and frustrating, I understand that its covered in the T&C, weather can be unpredictable sometimes, a refund maybe impossible but at least a compensation pass for the next visit, Hotham can do better, we won't be going back with so many better choices in Victoria!
Slopes be slopin fr fr
Fantastic alpine resort

The snow is so thick here. We went up on the 23rd July 2025 and it was incredibly windy and snowy - the full snow experience. They've added Wire Plain too in recent years to allow taboggan runs and the Cafe there is pretty good. Plenty of day parking too. You do need to buy a day pass and have snow chains attached the ready. Can be slow going up and down the mountain due to conditions too. Download the app beforehand as it makes getting information much easier. Good reception up there too.
Very scenic. Surely, find a place to stay there for a day or two to enjoy the beau

Amazing ski resort - plenty of blue hills, and black hills. Wish it had a few more greens, but big D and the Summit almost always run (they are green hills, ideal for learning and beginners) - where as blues and blacks sometimes shut down due to weather/not enough snow. The parking is a bit chaotic and spread out, but there are bus stops running regularly along the lots to take you around the ski resort.

Mornings are always hectic and you may have to wait for 2-3 buses. The drivers really should call out the stops as the windows fog up and they sometimes skip stops. The parking is usually a bit muddy on wet days and the food selection at the cafes is limited to mostly fried foods, over priced and unhealthy. They also need a few more washroom spots throughout the area, but in the grand scheme of things, if trying to get some skiing done in Victoria, this is definitely a must do place and overall probably the best in Australia!

The biggest improvement from past years is if doing an adult lesson and dropping your kids to their lesson, the drop off is now the same location - Hotham Central - and ski rentals are still reasonably priced. Their cancellation policy is a bit unforgiving (refunds only come with medical certificates) but snow credit is offered w 48 hr notice... and is good for remaining season +1 yr so makes it easier to pre-book with some confidence that you won't lose money. Good for locals, but not good for international folks who may never come back!

Their app is good, only problem is the lift closure status is not updated very quickly at times of strong winds or inclement weather conditions.

A great ski resort, totally worth visiting when weather is good. I suggest a hearty breakfast, bring some healthy snacks of your own and keep in a locker and grab dinner outside the resort.

Extremely disappointing experience at Mt Hotham.
Nearly 95% of the staff seemed to be young, untrained backpackers with little to no service skills. The food across cafes and restaurants was overpriced and lacked any real value -- honestly, zero bang for your buck.

By the time you factor in lift passes, gear rental, snow chains, and parking, it adds up fast -- but sadly, the experience doesn't deliver. Despite multiple fireplaces around the resort, not a single one was on... in the middle of winter. At a ski resort. Makes no sense.

We booked three full days of snowboarding lessons for the kids -- 28 children and only two very young, clearly inexperienced instructors. Total chaos and a complete waste of money.

Very little presence from senior management. Overall, avoid this place. There are far better ski resorts in Victoria where your time and money will go further.

We had a fantastic time--this is a perfect spot for families. When we visited, the area was blanketed in snow and fog, creating a truly magical atmosphere.

Snow chains are essential and can be rented from Hoys Skis in Harrietville, just before the climb. You're not required to fit them unless it's snowing, but it's mandatory to carry them in your vehicle. Note that chains may not be suitable for vehicles with tyres larger than 19 inches.Toboggans are also available for hire and are a big hit with the kids!

Parking can be a bit challenging, but free shuttle buses run frequently between key areas. A resort entry permit is required (around $70), and it's best to book it online in advance. The drive up from the valley to the resort is quite steep, with a speed limit of 40 km/h.

A bumper snow season has made it extra enjoyable during the school holidays.
Well organized and managed resort with helpful and knowledgeable people assisting and ready to help.
Would prefer to stay overnight to enjoy different parts of the day with changing weather. A little overpriced but worth the place, and the scenery is so good.
Chair lifts are wonderful experiences, and it is must go place for skiers/ snowboarding.
Tobogganing slope for everyone who just likes to slide and enjoy the snow.

NO BEGINNERS FRIENDLY AT ALL. Absolutely freezing and miserable! The chair lifts take you to the top of the mountain, fully exposed to howling winds and icy conditions. Sitting on bare metal with no wind protection felt torturous -- and the lift stopped for 10 minutes in the middle! After just one run, I couldn't bring myself to go again. Will definitely not be coming back.

everything from rentals, to slopes and weather was perfect when me and my large group of friends went there a few days ago. however one important thing to note was on-slope hospitality. the summit ski lift staff was not very attentive, it led to a severe injury that i had, i fell first on my head (thank god i had a helmet otherwise i would've died) then fell on my right bum. its bruised and the doctor told me it'll heal in weeks. they didn't warn me ahead of time or help me get off safely they just watched and yelled LAST MINUTE to get off. it did ruin my whole day to be honest, otherwise the weather and snow made me a little less miserable to continue skiing for a bit. FIX THIS! i saw many, many people even about almost all of my friends fell of that ski lift as well. we know well something is the problem here. thanks!

Perhaps we came too late--this year's ski season has been unusually short. At this point, only a few runs are open, and the snow conditions are poor. Both beginners and advanced skiers are packed onto just a couple of slopes, which makes it hard to fully enjoy the skiing experience.
